moves.1. e4: This is my type of opening.
moves.1... e5 2. Qg4: This is where I bring my queen, and Jack Stockel has told me that it is ok to have an early queen exposure, in some cases.
moves.2... Bc5 3. b3: I am not aware that Pat is about to bring out his Queen.  Instead, I do not think about anything, so I played b3.  This is a bad choice that I will later regret.
moves.3... Qf6: Now he brings out his queen, and I am in some trouble.  Instead, of figuring a way out of trouble, I panic and make a move that will destroy, immediately loose, this game on the next move.
moves.4. Ba3: I should have played Nf3, and this would have temporarily bailed me out of trouble.  Instead, I play Ba3, so I am now doomed on my next move.
moves.5. Kd1: There are no other choices but to play kd1 because it is the only move that is available.  The game ends on the next move.
moves.5... Qxf1#: Now, the game is over, and this was my worst game ever.  This game involved OTB chess, and it took place before I knew Jack Stockel or this site.  It happened approximately 10-12 years.  It was between my first and fourth of playing.  At that point, I was still horrible at chess.
